revised_title: A Discussion on Friction: Theoretical Considerations and Elastic Deformation
tldr: The authors discuss the conditions under which surface irregularities can deform elastically, providing a theoretical analysis of friction and the role of elastic deformation in lubrication. They consider the critical load required to level irregularities and the importance of understanding the difference between permanent and temporary (elastic) levelling. The authors also explore the potential for elastic deformation to affect the permissible minimum film thickness in hydrodynamic lubrication.
